resources.string:
- It's most likely worthwhile to pay off all your debts/loans as fast as possible at the expense of your wants. 

- Always pay off your credit card on time. Treat it like a debit card, do not spend what you do not have. 

- It is generally considered good practice to have an emergency fund. 

- Try to use the 50/30/20 rule, which is 50% for needs, 30% for wants, and 20% for paying off debts or savings. 

- Review your spending habits and make sure that you are not spending too much on wants. 

- Every month is different, for example December, so plan your spending around these times. 

- Track your spending so that when you review you can view all of the various expenses and cut back where you need to.
